newsitem.title: USA: Sabratek denies SIMS infringement claim.
newsitem.headline: Sabratek denies SIMS infringement claim.

text.p: Sabratek Corp said it intends to defend its products against patent infringement charges by SIMS Deltec Inc.

"Sabratek intends to vigorously defend against Deltec's charges. In particular, Sabratek intends to prove that its MediVIEW system does not infringe any valid claim of Deltec's patent," said Shan Padda, Sabratek chairman, in a statement.
Sabratek's technology is protected by its own patents, as well as patents pending, he said.

Sabratek develops, produces and markets interactive therapeutic and diagnostic medical systems designed for the alternate-site healthcare market. Its MediVIEW system provides remote programming and real-time diagnostic capabilities.

SIMS Deltec filed a patent infringement suit in U.S. District Court in Minnesota against Sabratek on February 20. The complaint alleges that Sabratek's MediVIEW software in combination with its infusion pump infringes SIMS Deltec's patent. The suit asks that Sabratek by stopped from further infringing on the patent and seeks unspecified monetary damages.
SIMS Deltec, a unit of Smiths Industries Medical Systems based in London, makes and markets drug delivery systems.
